alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 9:54PM EDT until July 04 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until midnight EDT. * At 954 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Kennett Square, Oxford, West Grove, Kemblesville, Cochranville, Landenberg, Homeville, North Star, Mount Vernon, Glen Roy, Hockessin, and Avondale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
